thread.title: Midseason report: Position-by-position grades for Texas, TCU, Baylor, Texas A&M, Oklahoma and more
thread.title_full: Midseason report: Position-by-position grades for Texas, TCU, Baylor, Texas A&M, Oklahoma and more | Dallas Morning News

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Midseason report: Position-by-position grades for Texas, TCU, Baylor, Texas A&M, Oklahoma and more
text:
College football has reached the midway point of the 2015 season.
There are plenty of storylines among Big 12 teams, Texas A&M, SMU and North Texas.
Baylor and TCU appear to be on a collision course for the Big 12 title. Texas, which got off to a slow start, may have righted itself with its Red River Showdown upset of Oklahoma. The Sooners bounced back in a big way following the defeat.
Texas Tech almost upset TCU. The Red Raiders likely will have a lot to say about which team wins the Big 12.
Texas A&M got off to a second straight 5-0 start. But can the Aggies avoid another midseason slump after their home loss to Alabama.
Can SMU and North Texas turn things around in the second half.
Below are midseason grade reports for area teams from SportsDay's college bloggers in reverse alphabetical order.
Texas Tech Red Raiders
How a steady offensive line can make everyone look good
Twitter: @MikeDupont_
For more on the Red Raiders, click here .

Special teams unit receives highest grade; struggles at offensive line, linebacker
